Key Arguments: The legislation is viewed as an attempt at censorship and an infringement on free speech.
The government is accused of being biased and incapable of impartially enforcing misinformation policies.
The bill is seen as protecting large media companies while targeting ordinary individuals.
The legislation is believed to exacerbate distrust in government and official information.
Existing laws are deemed sufficient for addressing fraud and negligence without new legislation.
Notable Quotes: "Misinformation", or as we used to call it, "accidentally being wrong about something while talking to your friends" is a basic human right.
"This bill is almost certainly going to make telling Woke lies compulsory and telling the truth illegal."
"Everyone will know they live in a totalitarian dictatorship with a ministry of truth, and nobody will trust the government."
